Pangolin
Pangolin is a lightweight rapid development library for managing OpenGL display / interaction and video input

28 #ifndef PANGOLIN_VIDEO_H
29 #define PANGOLIN_VIDEO_H
30 
31 // Pangolin video supports various cameras and file formats through
32 // different 3rd party libraries.
33 //
34 // Video URI's take the following form:
35 // scheme:[param1=value1,param2=value2,...]//device
36 //
37 // scheme = file | dc1394 | v4l | openni | convert | mjpeg
38 //
39 // files - read one or more streams from image files
40 // e.g. "files://~/data/dataset/img_*.jpg"
41 // e.g. "files://~/data/dataset/img_[left,right]_*.pgm"
42 //
43 // file/files - read PVN file format (pangolin video) or other formats using ffmpeg
44 // e.g. "file:[realtime=1]///home/user/video/movie.pvn"
45 // e.g. "file:[stream=1]///home/user/video/movie.avi"
46 // e.g. "files:///home/user/sequence/foo%03d.jpeg"
47 //
48 // dc1394 - capture video through a firewire camera
49 // e.g. "dc1394:[fmt=RGB24,size=640x480,fps=30,iso=400,dma=10]//0"
50 // e.g. "dc1394:[fmt=FORMAT7_1,size=640x480,pos=2+2,iso=400,dma=10]//0"
51 // e.g. "dc1394:[fmt=FORMAT7_3,deinterlace=1]//0"
52 //
53 // v4l - capture video from a Video4Linux (USB) camera (normally YUVY422 format)
54 // method=mmap|read|userptr
55 // e.g. "v4l:///dev/video0"
56 // e.g. "v4l[method=mmap]:///dev/video0"
57 //
58 // openni2 - capture video / depth from OpenNI2 SDK (Kinect / Xtrion etc)
59 // imgN=grey|rgb|ir|ir8|ir24|depth|reg_depth
60 // e.g. "openni2://'
61 // e.g. "openni2:[img1=rgb,img2=depth,coloursync=true]//"
62 // e.g. "openni2:[img1=depth,close=closerange,holefilter=true]//"
63 // e.g. "openni2:[size=320x240,fps=60,img1=ir]//"
64 //
65 // openni - capture video / depth from OpenNI 1.0 SDK (Kinect / Xtrion etc)
66 // Sensor modes containing '8' will truncate to 8-bits.
67 // Sensor modes containing '+' explicitly enable IR illuminator
68 // imgN=rgb|ir|ir8|ir+|ir8+|depth|reg_depth
69 // autoexposure=true|false
70 // e.g. "openni://'
71 // e.g. "openni:[img1=rgb,img2=depth]//"
72 // e.g. "openni:[size=320x240,fps=60,img1=ir]//"
73 //
74 // depthsense - capture video / depth from DepthSense SDK.
75 // DepthSenseViewer can be used to alter capture settings.
76 // imgN=depth|rgb
77 // sizeN=QVGA|320x240|...
78 // fpsN=25|30|60|...
79 // e.g. "depthsense://"
80 // e.g. "depthsense:[img1=depth,img2=rgb]//"
81 //
82 // convert - use FFMPEG to convert between video pixel formats
83 // e.g. "convert:[fmt=RGB24]//v4l:///dev/video0"
84 // e.g. "convert:[fmt=GRAY8]//v4l:///dev/video0"
85 //
86 // mjpeg - capture from (possibly networked) motion jpeg stream using FFMPEG
87 // e.g. "mjpeg://http://127.0.0.1/?action=stream"
88 //
89 // split - split an input video into a one or more streams based on Region of Interest / memory specification
90 // roiN=X+Y+WxH
91 // memN=Offset:WxH:PitchBytes:Format
92 // e.g. "split:[roi1=0+0+640x480,roi2=640+0+640x480]//files:///home/user/sequence/foo%03d.jpeg"
93 // e.g. "split:[mem1=307200:640x480:1280:GRAY8,roi2=640+0+640x480]//files:///home/user/sequence/foo%03d.jpeg"
94 //
95 // debayer - debayer an input video stream
96 // e.g. "debayer://v4l:///dev/video0
97 //
98 // test - output test video sequence
99 // e.g. "test://"
100 // e.g. "test:[size=640x480,fmt=RGB24]//"
101

108 namespace pangolin

110 
111 class PANGOLIN_EXPORT StreamInfo
112 {
113 public:
114  inline StreamInfo()
115  : fmt(VideoFormatFromString("GRAY8")) {}
116 
117  inline StreamInfo(VideoPixelFormat fmt, const Image<unsigned char> img_offset )
118  : fmt(fmt), img_offset(img_offset) {}
119 
120  inline StreamInfo(VideoPixelFormat fmt, size_t w, size_t h, size_t pitch, unsigned char* offset = 0)
121  : fmt(fmt), img_offset(w,h,pitch,offset) {}
122 
123  //! Format representing how image is layed out in memory
124  inline VideoPixelFormat PixFormat() const { return fmt; }
125 
126  //! Image width in pixels
127  inline size_t Width() const { return img_offset.w; }
128 
129  //! Image height in pixels
130  inline size_t Height() const { return img_offset.h; }
131 
132  inline double Aspect() const { return (double)Width() / (double)Height(); }
133 
134  //! Pitch: Number of bytes between one image row and the next
135  inline size_t Pitch() const { return img_offset.pitch; }
136 
137  //! Number of contiguous bytes in memory that the image occupies
138  inline size_t SizeBytes() const { return img_offset.h * img_offset.pitch; }
139 
140  //! Offset in bytes relative to start of frame buffer
141  inline unsigned char* Offset() const { return img_offset.ptr; }
142 
143  //! Return Image wrapper around raw base pointer
144  Image<unsigned char> StreamImage(unsigned char* base_ptr) const {
145  Image<unsigned char> img = img_offset;
146  img.ptr += (size_t)base_ptr;
147  return img;
148  }
149 
150 protected:
151  VideoPixelFormat fmt;
152  Image<unsigned char> img_offset;
153 };
154 
155 //! Interface to video capture sources
156 struct PANGOLIN_EXPORT VideoInterface
157 {
158  virtual ~VideoInterface() {}
159 
160  //! Required buffer size to store all frames
161  virtual size_t SizeBytes() const = 0;
162 
163  //! Get format and dimensions of all video streams
164  virtual const std::vector<StreamInfo>& Streams() const = 0;
165 
166  //! Start Video device
167  virtual void Start() = 0;
168 
169  //! Stop Video device
170  virtual void Stop() = 0;
171 
172  //! Copy the next frame from the camera to image.
173  //! Optionally wait for a frame if one isn't ready
174  //! Returns true iff image was copied
175  virtual bool GrabNext( unsigned char* image, bool wait = true ) = 0;
176 
177  //! Copy the newest frame from the camera to image
178  //! discarding all older frames.
179  //! Optionally wait for a frame if one isn't ready
180  //! Returns true iff image was copied
181  virtual bool GrabNewest( unsigned char* image, bool wait = true ) = 0;
182 };
183 
184 struct PANGOLIN_EXPORT VideoPropertiesInterface
185 {
186  //! Access JSON properties of device
187  virtual const json::value& DeviceProperties() const = 0;
188 
189  //! Access JSON properties of most recently captured frame
190  virtual const json::value& FrameProperties() const = 0;
191 };

193 enum UvcRequestCode {
194  UVC_RC_UNDEFINED = 0x00,
195  UVC_SET_CUR = 0x01,
196  UVC_GET_CUR = 0x81,
197  UVC_GET_MIN = 0x82,
198  UVC_GET_MAX = 0x83,
199  UVC_GET_RES = 0x84,
200  UVC_GET_LEN = 0x85,
201  UVC_GET_INFO = 0x86,
202  UVC_GET_DEF = 0x87
203 };
204 
205 struct PANGOLIN_EXPORT VideoFilterInterface
206 {
207  template<typename T>
208  std::vector<T*> FindMatchingStreams()
209  {
210  std::vector<T*> matches;
211  std::vector<VideoInterface*> children = InputStreams();
212  for(size_t c=0; c < children.size(); ++c) {
213  T* concrete_video = dynamic_cast<T*>(children[c]);
214  if(concrete_video) {
215  matches.push_back(concrete_video);
216  }else{
217  VideoFilterInterface* filter_video = dynamic_cast<VideoFilterInterface*>(children[c]);
218  if(filter_video) {
219  std::vector<T*> child_matches = filter_video->FindMatchingStreams<T>();
220  matches.insert(matches.end(), child_matches.begin(), child_matches.end());
221  }
222  }
223  }
224  return matches;
225  }
226 
227  virtual std::vector<VideoInterface*>& InputStreams() = 0;
228 };
229 
230 struct PANGOLIN_EXPORT VideoUvcInterface
231 {
232  virtual int IoCtrl(uint8_t unit, uint8_t ctrl, unsigned char* data, int len, UvcRequestCode req_code) = 0;
233 };
234 
235 struct PANGOLIN_EXPORT VideoPlaybackInterface
236 {
237  /// Return monotonic id of current frame
238  virtual int GetCurrentFrameId() const = 0;
239 
240  /// Return total number of frames to be captured from device,
241  /// or std::numeric_limits<int>::max() on failure.
242  virtual int GetTotalFrames() const = 0;
243 
244  /// Return -1 on failure, frameid on success
245  virtual int Seek(int frameid) = 0;
246 };

248 //! Generic wrapper class for different video sources
249 struct PANGOLIN_EXPORT VideoInput : public VideoInterface
250 {
251  VideoInput();
252  VideoInput(const std::string& uri);
253  ~VideoInput();
254 
255  void Open(const std::string& uri);
256  void Reset();
257 
258  size_t SizeBytes() const;
259  const std::vector<StreamInfo>& Streams() const;
260 
261  // Return details of first stream
262  unsigned Width() const;
263  unsigned Height() const;
264  VideoPixelFormat PixFormat() const;
265  const Uri& VideoUri() const;
266 
267  void Start();
268  void Stop();
269  bool GrabNext( unsigned char* image, bool wait = true );
270  bool GrabNewest( unsigned char* image, bool wait = true );
271 
272  // Return pointer to inner video class as VideoType
273  template<typename VideoType>
274  VideoType* Cast() {
275  return dynamic_cast<VideoType*>(video);
276  }
277 
278  // experimental - not stable
279  bool Grab( unsigned char* buffer, std::vector<Image<unsigned char> >& images, bool wait = true, bool newest = false);
280 
281 protected:
282  Uri uri;
283  VideoInterface* video;
284 };

288 VideoInterface* OpenVideo(const std::string& uri);

290 //! Open Video Interface from Uri specification
291 PANGOLIN_EXPORT
292 VideoInterface* OpenVideo(const Uri& uri);

294 }
